item.title: 全球供应紧张，铂金飙升至创纪录的 2300 美元以上
item.description: 由于供应紧张和借贷成本的历史性升高，铂金飙升至历史新高，交易价格首次突破每盎司 2,300 美元。【原文：Platinum soared to an all-time high, trading above $2,300 an ounce for the first time on tight supplies and historically elevated borrowing costs.】

item.title: 韩国誓言 "坚决反对 "货币政策，韩元跳涨
item.description: 韩国表示，韩元过度疲软并不可取，外汇市场将很快看到政府的坚定决心。韩元走强。【原文：South Korea said excessive won weakness isn’t desirable and foreign-exchange markets will soon see the government’s strong determination. The currency strengthened.】

item.title: 为什么 Instacart 在人工智能定价实验上出尔反尔？
item.description:
今日要闻：Instacart 在一次定价实验中向部分消费者收取了更高的价格。这引起了购物者和立法者的关注。【原文：

Today on the Big Take: Instacart charged some consumers more for the same goods in a pricing experiment. It caught the attention of shoppers — and lawmakers.

】

item.title: 受地缘政治和利率影响，黄金首次飙升至 4,500 美元以上
item.description: 由于委内瑞拉紧张局势升级以及对美国明年将进一步降息的预期，黄金上涨至创纪录水平，首次突破每盎司4,500美元。【原文：Gold rose to a record, pushing above $4,500 an ounce for the first time, on escalating tensions in Venezuela and expectations for more US rate cuts next year.】

item.title: 地缘政治、库存成为焦点，石油维持五日涨势
item.description: 由于交易商在权衡地缘政治紧张局势升级与库存膨胀之间的关系，石油保持了连续五天的涨势。【原文：Oil held a five-day gain as traders weighed escalating geopolitical tensions against swelling inventories.】

item.title: 三色公司首席执行官在被控欺诈前一年收取了 3,000 万美元
item.description: 根据负责监督 Tricolor Holdings 公司清算的受托人提起的诉讼，该公司创始人丹尼尔-朱（Daniel Chu）在次贷汽车贷款公司因涉嫌欺诈而倒闭前的一年里收取了近 3,000 万美元的赔偿金。【原文：Tricolor Holdings founder Daniel Chu collected nearly $30 million in compensation in the year leading up to the subprime auto lender’s collapse amid alleged fraud, according to a lawsuit filed by the trustee overseeing the company’s liquidation.】

item.title: 中国商飞有望将 C919 的交付目标减半
item.description: 中国商用飞机有限责任公司（Commercial Aircraft Corp of China Ltd.，简称 "中国商飞"）将无法实现其最重要的 C919 单通道喷气机的修订交付目标，这对其全球雄心造成了打击，因为贸易战引发的逆风阻碍了生产。【原文：Commercial Aircraft Corp of China Ltd. is set to miss a revised delivery target for its marquee C919 single-aisle jet, dealing a blow to its global ambitions after trade war-induced headwinds helped hamper production.】

item.title: ServiceNow 首席执行官麦克德莫特续约至 2030 年
item.description: ServiceNow Inc.首席执行官比尔-麦克德莫特（Bill McDermott）延长了他与这家软件供应商的合同，至少到 2030 年底。【原文：ServiceNow Inc. Chief Executive Officer Bill McDermott extended his contract to remain with the software provider through at least the end of 2030.】

item.title: 谷歌支持的车队追踪公司 Motive 公开申请 IPO
item.description: Motive Technologies 公司公开申请首次公开募股，这家人工智能车队管理软件公司披露了不断增长的收入和净亏损。【原文：Motive Technologies Inc. filed publicly for an initial public offering, with the artificial intelligence-enabled fleet management software firm disclosing both growing revenue and net losses.】

item.title: 科技股提振华尔街后亚洲股市将上涨：市场综述
item.description: 在科技股领涨推动华尔街创下历史纪录、数据显示美国经济以两年来最快速度增长之后，亚洲股市将追随美股走高。黄金和白银创下历史新高。【原文：Asian stocks were set to follow US shares higher after tech-led gains pushed Wall Street to a record and data showed the economy grew at its fastest pace in two years. Gold and silver hit all-time highs.】

item.title: 第一品牌贸易融资方寻求停止使用部分现金
item.description: First Brands 集团的一个主要贸易融资合作伙伴威胁说，它有权继续动用向这家破产的汽车零部件供应商提供的现金，并称其部分抵押品的价值已低于商定的阈值。【原文：A major trade finance partner of First Brands Group threatened its right to keep tapping cash made available to the bankrupt auto parts supplier, saying the value of some of its collateral has fallen below agreed-upon thresholds.】

item.title: 玻利维亚表示特斯拉、亚马逊和甲骨文将在该国投资
item.description: 玻利维亚新任总统罗德里戈-帕斯（Rodrigo Paz）周二表示，美国大型科技公司不久将宣布在这个南美内陆国家投资。【原文：Bolivia’s new President Rodrigo Paz said on Tuesday that major US technology companies will soon announce investments in the landlocked South American nation.】

item.title: 美国制裁欧盟前官员等人，向欧洲开刀
item.description: 特朗普政府周二对欧盟前委员蒂埃里-布勒东（Thierry Breton）等四人实施了签证制裁，原因是他们试图让美国科技公司在其平台上对政治言论进行监管。【原文：The Trump administration on Tuesday imposed visa sanctions on former European Union Commissioner Thierry Breton and four other people for trying to make American tech companies police political speech on their platforms.】

item.title: 中国电动汽车电池巨头正努力寻找新道路
item.description:
CATL以廉价、高效的电池充斥着国内市场。它希望在海外采取同样的做法，但欧洲政客和唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump—）阻碍了它的发展。【原文：

CATL flooded the domestic market with inexpensive, efficient batteries. It wants to do the same overseas, but European politicians—and Donald Trump—stand in its way.

】

item.title: 基础设施债券枯竭，中国陷入投资低谷
item.description: 中国用于基础设施建设的地方借贷将创下六年来的新低，这是因为中国政府在战略上进行了调整，对风险进行了控制，这使人们对其阻止前所未有的投资下滑的承诺产生了怀疑。【原文：China’s local borrowing for infrastructure spending is on pace to hit a six-year low, as Beijing clamps down on risks in a strategy shift that calls into question its promise to stop an unprecedented investment slump.】

item.title: 韩国消费者信心指数连续第 8 个月保持乐观
item.description: 12 月份，韩国消费者信心指数连续第八个月保持在中性水平以上，表明家庭信心持续乐观。【原文：South Korea’s consumer confidence stayed above the neutral level for an eighth straight month in December, pointing to continued household optimism.】

item.title: 乌拉圭将关键利率降至 7.5%，通胀率低于目标值
item.description: 乌拉圭央行出人意料地将借贷成本降低了半个百分点，使基准利率保持在 7.5%，而此前几个月的通货膨胀率一直低于目标。【原文：Uruguay’s central bank surprised investors with a half-point reduction in borrowing costs that left the benchmark interest rate at 7.5% after months of below-target inflation.】

item.title: 首席信息官警告：澳大利亚私人信贷在房地产押注方面风险更大
item.description: 澳大利亚一些最大的基金表示，由于私人信贷投资在房地产行业所占的比重很大，因此风险越来越大。【原文：Private-credit investments are growing increasingly risky in Australia due to their heavy weighting toward the property sector, some of the nation’s biggest funds say.】

item.title: 加拿大央行不确定下一步是降息还是加息
item.description: 加拿大央行官员本月早些时候同意将隔夜利率维持在 2.25%，但目前还不确定他们下一步的政策转变是再次降低利率还是提高利率。【原文：Bank of Canada officials agreed on holding the overnight rate at 2.25% earlier this month, but are unsure whether their next policy shift will be to lower rates again or to raise them.】

item.title: 美国联邦政府批准 Sable 公司在加利福尼亚州铺设有争议的输油管道
item.description: 联邦监管机构批准重新启动 Sable Offshore 公司有争议的加州输油管道，该管道十年前在圣巴巴拉海岸线泄漏了 3000 桶原油。【原文：A federal regulator approved the restart of Sable Offshore Corp.’s contested California oil pipeline that leaked 3,000 barrels of crude along the Santa Barbara coastline a decade ago.】

item.title: 就业预期继续下滑
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 芝加哥市长决定不否决预算案，但不会签字
item.description: 芝加哥市长布兰登-约翰逊（Brandon Johnson）周二表示，他将不会签署或否决市议会支持的 2026 年预算案，这意味着该支出计划将在未经他认可的情况下生效。这一决定距避免政府关门的最后期限还有一周时间。【原文：Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson will not sign nor veto a city council backed budget for 2026, he said on Tuesday, meaning the spending plan will go into effect without his endorsement. The decision comes about one week before the deadline to avoid a possible government shutdown.】

item.title: 阿根廷人大量购买短期债券以躲避外汇管制
item.description: 阿根廷的企业和投资者正在花高价囤积美元，以创造性地规避哈维尔-米莱伊总统的货币管制。【原文：Argentine businesses and investors are paying a premium to stock up on dollars in a creative effort to sidestep President Javier Milei’s currency controls.】

item.title: 尽管存在风险，利比亚的石油储备和改革仍吸引着投资者
item.description: 尽管存在固有的政治风险，利比亚巨大的化石燃料潜力和 "对投资者友好的改革 "正吸引着全球能源公司，这对这个石油资源丰富的非洲国家来说是个鼓舞。【原文：Libya’s vast fossil fuel potential and “investor-friendly reforms” are attracting global energy firms despite the inherent political risks, a boost for the oil-rich African nation.】

item.title: 据说 Hg 支持的 Visma 公司将在大宗软件首次公开募股中增加 11 家银行
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Visma AS 已将银行纳入其首次公开募股计划的阵容，这可能是欧洲近十年来规模最大的首次公开募股之一。【原文：Visma AS has added banks to the lineup of its planned initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter, in what could be one of Europe’s largest debuts this decade.】

item.title: Citadel 将向客户返还 50 亿美元对冲基金利润
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，肯-格里芬（Ken Griffin）的 Citadel 公司将返还今年赚取的约 50 亿美元利润，使其管理的资产达到 670 亿美元。【原文：Ken Griffin’s Citadel will return about $5 billion of profits earned this year, bringing its assets under management to $67 billion, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 特朗普突击检查 ICE 减少了加州特许学校的债务收入
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统打击移民活动的背景下，加州一所特许学校的招生人数出现下滑，而该校大部分是西班牙裔学生，因此该特许学校的运营者请求允许其在支付债券所需的资金缓冲方面有所欠缺。【原文：A California charter school operator has asked for permission to fall short of a financial cushion required to cover its bond payments after enrollment slid at its mostly Hispanic campuses amid President Donald Trump’s immigration crackdown.】

item.title: 土耳其将最低工资提高 27%，符合预期
item.description: 土耳其将明年的最低工资上调了 27%，与市场预期基本一致，这表明政策制定者仍致力于为通胀降温。【原文：Turkey increased the minimum wage for next year by 27%, broadly in line with market expectations, in a sign policymakers remain committed to cooling inflation.】

item.title: 双线警告发达经济体 "酝酿碰撞
item.description: 从法国、英国到日本，各国政府都在努力平衡社会需求与不断膨胀的财政赤字之间的关系，因此，DoubleLine 公司警告说，一些发达经济体正在 "酝酿一场碰撞"。【原文：DoubleLine is warning of a “brewing collision” in some developed economies as governments from France to the UK and Japan struggle to balance social demands against ballooning fiscal deficits.】

item.title: 贝森特认为美联储 2% 通胀目标未来仍有修改空间
item.description: 财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）支持这样的观点，即一旦美国可持续地将物价上涨速度回落到 2% 的水平，就应重新考虑美联储 2% 的通胀目标。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent backed the idea of reconsidering the Federal Reserve’s 2% inflation target once the US has sustainably brought price increases back down to that pace.】
